text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we started to see the evidence of early human civilisation, for example, through cave paintings; however, no one knows how this connects to language. Brains did not suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it using language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?
